item.title: Machine Learning
item.description:
Yuhao's Blog http://localhost:1313/posts/cs/ml_stanford/ -

Machine Learning

Ref: https://www.coursera.org/learn/machine-learning

Mimic human learning process of generating output based on specified inputs, like a turning machine

Supervised Machine Learning

Regression and Classification

  • Linear regression
  • logistic regression
  • gradient descent

Neural Network

Problem: high training error - high bias
Solution: consider more features -> use larger neural network

Problem: high correlation error - high variance
Solution: cut weights of some features -> use more data

Understanding comes from talent & intelligence, Deduction comes from learning & experience

Iterative Loop of ML development

  1. Choose architecture (model, data etc)
  2. Train model
  3. Diagnostics(bias, variance, error analysis)

AI = Code + Data

What if you don’t have data?

  1. Hand labeling critical data bins
  2. Synthesis data by adding variations of existing datasets (ex. rotate text fonts)

Transfer Learning: Supervised pre-training + fine tuning

  • Only train output layers parameters
  • train all parameters

Decision tree

recursively picking the tree split that reduce enthropy the best

Random Forest algorithm: Use multiple distinctive decision trees XGBoost Tree: train the tree on samples that doesn’t preform well in previous iterations

Unsupervised Learning

  • Clustering
    • K-means
  • Anomaly detection
    • Probability Density estimation, ex. 3Ïƒ for gaussian distribution features
  • Recommender System
    • Collaborative filtering
    • Deep-learning for content based filtering
    • Recommending from a large catalogue
      • Retrival & Ranking
  • Reinforcement Learning
    • state machine + positive/negative return, ex. good dog/bad dog
    • Markov Decision Process(MDP)
    • State-action value function
      • Belllman Equation

Machine Learning in Production

Lifecycle of ML

  1. Scope Project
  2. Collect Data
    • Define data and establish baseline
    • Label and organize data
  3. Train Model
    • Select and train model
    • Perform error analysis
  4. Deploy in production
    • Deploy in production
    • Monitor & maintain system
- http://localhost:1313/posts/cs/ml_stanford/ -

item.title: Array and Strings
Tree and Graphs
About Me
item.description:
Yuhao's Blog http://localhost:1313/posts/about/ -

Hello, welcome to my Blog.

I am a senior engineer at Qualcomm working on system level test of AI laptop processor and premium tier mobile phone chipsets.

This is a place where I note down my thoughts and learning process of new technologies. Most of the blog posts will focus on computing algorithms, system optimizations and communication networks.

If you have any questions, feel free to reach me at:

Email: yuhao.lu@hotmail.com Linkedin: www.linkedin.com/in/yuhao-lu-dev/

Some facts about me:

  • I have great interests in:
    • Teach computers to read text and manuscripts like human.
    • Build high-concurrency, low-latency communication systems.
  • I am a Triathlate(Swim, Bike, Run) and Marathon runner.
    • Finished my 1st Marathon at Big Bear, LA in 4 hr 3 min.
  • I am a keyboard player.
- http://localhost:1313/posts/about/ -
